intro: Boehmeria cavaleriei, commonly known as the Chinese nettle or Chinese flax, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes many species of nettle. The plant is characterized by its hairy, alternate leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in mountainous regions. Its fibrous stalks have been historically used for textile production and traditional medicine.
